Pre-Game Insights: Armenia continues life without Henrikh Mkhitaryan, who retired from international football.
Varazdat Haroyan is the teamâ€™s most influential player.
Hovhannisyan, Bichakhchyan, and M'gladbach forward Ranos are also part of the squad.
Latvia struggled in the EURO 2024 qualifiers, collecting only three points in total.
Latvia is not regarded as good travellers, predicting Armenia to emerge victorious.
Daejeon attacker Vladislavs Gutkovskis has netted 11 goals in 45 appearances for the national team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Armenia footballers played for Soviet Union national football team until 1991, when the country declared independence.
The Football Federation of Armenia was founded the following year and quickly established relations with both FIFA (1992) and UEFA (1993).
Armenia played their first international game against Moldova in October, 1992 and drew with the former Soviet republic.
Armenia has slim chances of qualifying for the FIFA World Cup 2018 finals but did well to beat Montenegro in the process.
Armenia wears red shirts and red shorts when playing at home ground (Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium), while their away kits are white.
